property.value: A shura with American and Afghan leaders

note.text: Group deliberation is a key part of Afghan society and issues are discussed at length. In many rural areas, elders and religious leaders resolve disputes and handle issues of justice.

Meetings called “jirgas” and “shuras” are common. In jirgas, men gather to resolve disputes. In shuras, community affairs are discussed in the presence of people who will be affected by a decision. When attending meetings anywhere, it's not unusual for several local representatives to be present and for men to come and go from the discussion.
